content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mn>3</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </math>. If g is a function with derivative given by <math> <mrow> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math>, on what intervals is g increasing?

topic.text: 5.3: Determining Intervals on Which a Function Is Increasing or Decreasing

skill.text: Skill 2.E: Describe the relationships among different representations of functions and their derivatives.
